values.description:
This pull request will introduce the GameState class and its associated unit tests to the default branch. The GameState class contains logic for determining when to transition the play mode of the soccer simulation as well as handling various rule violations. 

More information on most but not all of the rules can be found here:
http://chaosscripting.net/files/competitions/RoboCup/WorldCup/2014/3DSim/RCSoccerSim3D_Rules2013.pdf
values.title: Adding GameState class and tests to default branch

summary.raw:
This pull request will introduce the GameState class and its associated unit tests to the default branch. The GameState class contains logic for determining when to transition the play mode of the soccer simulation as well as handling various rule violations. 

More information on most but not all of the rules can be found here:
http://chaosscripting.net/files/competitions/RoboCup/WorldCup/2014/3DSim/RCSoccerSim3D_Rules2013.pdf
summary.html:
This pull request will introduce the GameState class and its associated unit tests to the default branch. The GameState class contains logic for determining when to transition the play mode of the soccer simulation as well as handling various rule violations.

More information on most but not all of the rules can be found here: http://chaosscripting.net/files/competitions/RoboCup/WorldCup/2014/3DSim/RCSoccerSim3D_Rules2013.pdf

values.description:
This pull request introduces the Server class and its designed test unit to the default branch. The Server class contains functionality to handle communication between Server and multiple agents using TCP protocol and multithreading architecture.
In order to test the module, a sample agent was implemented in which the agent sends a sample action message to the server. In reply, the server sends back a sample sense message to the agent. The sample action and sense message is given in the format and length of the robocup simulation messages.
values.title: Server class and its test

summary.raw:
This pull request introduces the Server class and its designed test unit to the default branch. The Server class contains functionality to handle communication between Server and multiple agents using TCP protocol and multithreading architecture.
In order to test the module, a sample agent was implemented in which the agent sends a sample action message to the server. In reply, the server sends back a sample sense message to the agent. The sample action and sense message is given in the format and length of the robocup simulation messages.
summary.html: This pull request introduces the Server class and its designed test unit to the default branch. The Server class contains functionality to handle communication between Server and multiple agents using TCP protocol and multithreading architecture. In order to test the module, a sample agent was implemented in which the agent sends a sample action message to the server. In reply, the server sends back a sample sense message to the agent. The sample action and sense message is given in the format and length of the robocup simulation messages.

values.reason: New implementation based on branch `server_caguero` will be submitted.

values.description:
Instructions:

*  Install lcov package:
```
#!c++
sudo apt-get install lcov
```
* Run your tests. E.g.:
```
#!c++

make test
```
* Make the coverage report:

```
#!c++
make coverage
```

* View the coverage report:

```
#!c++

firefox ctest/index.html
```
values.title: Adding code coverage

values.description:
Before, the documentation was not generated properly. This patch should fix it.

Instructions for generating the documentation:

* Install doxygen:

```
#!c++

sudo apt-get install doxygen
```

* Generate the HTML documentation:
```
#!c++

make doc
```

* Browse through the documentation:


```
#!c++

firefox doxygen/html/index.html
```
values.title: Fix the generation of documentation

values.description:
This is a TCP server class. I've included some instructions and a description in Server.hh

Let me know if something is not clear, does not work or you have suggestions.

@nima_sh Take a look at the code. Your s-expression parser should implement a `Parse()` method for reading s-expressions from the socket. Let me know if you have any questions.

The coverage is 83% because there's some code difficult to cover. E.g.: When a socket option fails, etc. As far as I know all the code besides these corner cases is exercised in the test.
values.title: TCP server

summary.raw:
This is a TCP server class. I've included some instructions and a description in Server.hh

Let me know if something is not clear, does not work or you have suggestions.

@nima_sh Take a look at the code. Your s-expression parser should implement a `Parse()` method for reading s-expressions from the socket. Let me know if you have any questions.

The coverage is 83% because there's some code difficult to cover. E.g.: When a socket option fails, etc. As far as I know all the code besides these corner cases is exercised in the test.
summary.html:
This is a TCP server class. I've included some instructions and a description in Server.hh

Let me know if something is not clear, does not work or you have suggestions.

@nima_sh Take a look at the code. Your s-expression parser should implement a Parse() method for reading s-expressions from the socket. Let me know if you have any questions.

The coverage is 83% because there's some code difficult to cover. E.g.: When a socket option fails, etc. As far as I know all the code besides these corner cases is exercised in the test.

values.description:
This pull request adds the perceptor class to the code base. The perceptor class is responsible for extracting perception information from the gamestate, transforming into the agent's local coordinate frame, and passing it to the server to be sent back to the agents. 

More information regarding perceptors can be found here: http://simspark.sourceforge.net/wiki/index.php/Perceptors
values.title: Perceptor Class

summary.raw:
This pull request adds the perceptor class to the code base. The perceptor class is responsible for extracting perception information from the gamestate, transforming into the agent's local coordinate frame, and passing it to the server to be sent back to the agents. 

More information regarding perceptors can be found here: http://simspark.sourceforge.net/wiki/index.php/Perceptors
summary.html:
This pull request adds the perceptor class to the code base. The perceptor class is responsible for extracting perception information from the gamestate, transforming into the agent's local coordinate frame, and passing it to the server to be sent back to the agents.

More information regarding perceptors can be found here: http://simspark.sourceforge.net/wiki/index.php/Perceptors

values.description:
For some reason the default branch stopped building for me. This patch fixed it. The error I was getting was this:

~~~
/home/louise/code/robocup3ds/test/integration/physics.cc: In function ‘int main(int, char**)’:
/home/louise/code/robocup3ds/test/integration/physics.cc:38:3: error: incomplete type ‘gazebo::math::Rand’ used in nested name specifier
   gazebo::math::Rand::SetSeed(42);
   ^
make[2]: *** [test/integration/CMakeFiles/INTEGRATION_physics.dir/physics.cc.o] Error 1
make[1]: *** [test/integration/CMakeFiles/INTEGRATION_physics.dir/all] Error 2
make: *** [all] Error 2
~~~
values.title: Fix build

values.description: Here, the simspark NAO model (Type Zero) and its controller are ready. This pull request suggests that this model is merged with the rest of the codes. It uses the PID controller and simulator controls robots joints position based on RoboCup agents commands (Target joints Velocity). I could walk this robot with speed around 25 cm/s. In order to access the agent binary that can walk, please use this [link](https://feupload.fe.up.pt/get/aeluLuz1daE5DcK). The behavior of this agent in both Simspark and Gazebo should be similar.
values.title: Modeling of simspark NAO robot and its Controller

summary.raw: Here, the simspark NAO model (Type Zero) and its controller are ready. This pull request suggests that this model is merged with the rest of the codes. It uses the PID controller and simulator controls robots joints position based on RoboCup agents commands (Target joints Velocity). I could walk this robot with speed around 25 cm/s. In order to access the agent binary that can walk, please use this [link](https://feupload.fe.up.pt/get/aeluLuz1daE5DcK). The behavior of this agent in both Simspark and Gazebo should be similar.
summary.html: Here, the simspark NAO model (Type Zero) and its controller are ready. This pull request suggests that this model is merged with the rest of the codes. It uses the PID controller and simulator controls robots joints position based on RoboCup agents commands (Target joints Velocity). I could walk this robot with speed around 25 cm/s. In order to access the agent binary that can walk, please use this link. The behavior of this agent in both Simspark and Gazebo should be similar.

values.description:
This pull request suggests merging the robot model similar to one that is used in Simsaprk namely NAO_Type_Zero. Its description can be found in the [wiki](#!/osrf/robocup3ds/wiki/Robot%20Model) of the project . 
For testing the model, please run a RoboCup agent which can be found in this[ link](https://feupload.fe.up.pt/get/3HeAVUD1hq2UcGf).

Alternatively it is possible to run UTVilla agents can be succesfully loaded onto the field (download from [here](http://www.cs.utexas.edu/~AustinVilla/sim/3dsimulation/AustinVilla3DSimulationFiles/2015/binary/utaustinvilla.tar.bz2)). Please use ./start_penalty_kicker.sh or ./start.sh to run a single agent or eleven agents respectively.
values.title: Simspark robot model

summary.raw:
This pull request suggests merging the robot model similar to one that is used in Simsaprk namely NAO_Type_Zero. Its description can be found in the [wiki](#!/osrf/robocup3ds/wiki/Robot%20Model) of the project . 
For testing the model, please run a RoboCup agent which can be found in this[ link](https://feupload.fe.up.pt/get/3HeAVUD1hq2UcGf).

Alternatively it is possible to run UTVilla agents can be succesfully loaded onto the field (download from [here](http://www.cs.utexas.edu/~AustinVilla/sim/3dsimulation/AustinVilla3DSimulationFiles/2015/binary/utaustinvilla.tar.bz2)). Please use ./start_penalty_kicker.sh or ./start.sh to run a single agent or eleven agents respectively.
summary.html:
This pull request suggests merging the robot model similar to one that is used in Simsaprk namely NAO_Type_Zero. Its description can be found in the wiki of the project . For testing the model, please run a RoboCup agent which can be found in this link.

Alternatively it is possible to run UTVilla agents can be succesfully loaded onto the field (download from here). Please use ./start_penalty_kicker.sh or ./start.sh to run a single agent or eleven agents respectively.

values.description:
This adds some bugfixes and minor improvements. It also adds Nima's changes to support the simspark body type. 

To test this pull request, run the "run_agent" test executable (with gtest_filter argument in order to run each test separately) and ensure that each test succeeds. 

Also, visually verify that UTVilla agents can be succesfully loaded onto the field (download here: http://www.cs.utexas.edu/~AustinVilla/sim/3dsimulation/AustinVilla3DSimulationFiles/2015/binary/utaustinvilla.tar.bz2)
values.title: jliang_model_7

summary.raw:
This adds some bugfixes and minor improvements. It also adds Nima's changes to support the simspark body type. 

To test this pull request, run the "run_agent" test executable (with gtest_filter argument in order to run each test separately) and ensure that each test succeeds. 

Also, visually verify that UTVilla agents can be succesfully loaded onto the field (download here: http://www.cs.utexas.edu/~AustinVilla/sim/3dsimulation/AustinVilla3DSimulationFiles/2015/binary/utaustinvilla.tar.bz2)
summary.html:
This adds some bugfixes and minor improvements. It also adds Nima's changes to support the simspark body type.

To test this pull request, run the "run_agent" test executable (with gtest_filter argument in order to run each test separately) and ensure that each test succeeds.

Also, visually verify that UTVilla agents can be succesfully loaded onto the field (download here: http://www.cs.utexas.edu/~AustinVilla/sim/3dsimulation/AustinVilla3DSimulationFiles/2015/binary/utaustinvilla.tar.bz2)

values.title: Use arch dependant path for pkgconfig file

values.description:
1. Plugins are installed in <CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX>/lib/robocup3ds/
1. Models are installed in <CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX>/share/robocup3ds/models
1. Worlds are installed in  <CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX>/share/robocup3ds/worlds
1. gazebo-robocup3ds is installed in /usr/bin
1. setup.sh is installed in <CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX>/share/robocup3ds

In order to use robocup3ds, you have to execute:

```
#!c++

gazebo-robocup3ds
```
values.title: Change installation paths

summary.raw:
1. Plugins are installed in <CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX>/lib/robocup3ds/
1. Models are installed in <CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX>/share/robocup3ds/models
1. Worlds are installed in  <CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX>/share/robocup3ds/worlds
1. gazebo-robocup3ds is installed in /usr/bin
1. setup.sh is installed in <CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX>/share/robocup3ds

In order to use robocup3ds, you have to execute:

```
#!c++

gazebo-robocup3ds
```
summary.html:
1. Plugins are installed in <CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX>/lib/robocup3ds/
  2. Models are installed in <CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX>/share/robocup3ds/models
  3. Worlds are installed in <CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX>/share/robocup3ds/worlds
  4. gazebo-robocup3ds is installed in /usr/bin
  5. setup.sh is installed in <CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX>/share/robocup3ds

In order to use robocup3ds, you have to execute:

gazebo-robocup3ds

values.description:
See issue #12.

The fix is in `src/Effector.cc:71`. The flag `MSG_WAITALL` blocks `recv()` untill the 4 bytes containing the size of the message are read.

There are other minor fixes in this pull request.
values.title: Fix issue #12

summary.raw:
See issue #12.

The fix is in `src/Effector.cc:71`. The flag `MSG_WAITALL` blocks `recv()` untill the 4 bytes containing the size of the message are read.

There are other minor fixes in this pull request.
summary.html:
See issue #12.

The fix is in src/Effector.cc:71. The flag MSG_WAITALL blocks recv() untill the 4 bytes containing the size of the message are read.

There are other minor fixes in this pull request.

values.title: Keep the playmode combo box in sync with the current playmode, fixes #22
Keep playmode combo box in sync with actual playmode, fixes #22

values.description:
See issue #21.

* Disable timed transitions from `beforeKickoff` to `kickoff` if `SecondsBeforeKickOff` parameter is negative.

Agent insertion in play mode is a bit more tricky because with the current code the agent does not stay still nicely. It'll require more work to do, so we can tackle it later.
values.title: Fix issue #21 partially

summary.raw:
See issue #21.

* Disable timed transitions from `beforeKickoff` to `kickoff` if `SecondsBeforeKickOff` parameter is negative.

Agent insertion in play mode is a bit more tricky because with the current code the agent does not stay still nicely. It'll require more work to do, so we can tackle it later.
summary.html:
See issue #21.

  • Disable timed transitions from beforeKickoff to kickoff if SecondsBeforeKickOff parameter is negative.

Agent insertion in play mode is a bit more tricky because with the current code the agent does not stay still nicely. It'll require more work to do, so we can tackle it later.

values.description:
See issue #19.

We need to link with a few boost dependencies in the tests and `${Boost_LIBRARIES}` was not including all of the required libraries. The problem was in incomplete list of components when doing `find_package(Boost ...)`.
values.title: Fix issue #19
